translation: fourth and fourth in the fifth of the great aggregates, appropriation and acceptance of breath
"He realizes the fruit of stream-winner by virtue of the path of no-separation.

It means that there are some who say.
'There's no future cultivation.'
It's because there's nothing yet to be done that can be attained.
In order to stop their attachment, it's revealed that there will be future cultivation.
Even though it hasn't yet arisen, it's already arisen in some way.'
There's also the teaching that the two minds are acting together.
It's because they're both present at the same time, such as seeing and hearing.

source_sentence: 為遮彼執顯無二心俱行。
translation: In order to obviate that attachment, it shows that there aren't two minds that are both active.
It's because their momentary and rapid movements aren't both seemingly and necessarily the same.
It's also said that the four kinds of correct elimination and so forth are not useful at the same time.

source_sentence: 四正斷等非一時有用因異故。
translation: 'The fourfold correct elimination and so forth aren't useful at the same time because they have different causes.'

source_sentence: 為遮彼執顯此同時得有四種體無別故。
translation: It's to obviate their attachment and show that these four kinds of simultaneous attainment have no distinctive essence.
It's also been said.
'Belief and so forth are only uncontaminated.'
The sūtras say that it's because ordinary people don't have the faculties of faith and so forth.

source_sentence: 為遮彼執明信等通有漏。
translation: In order to obviate their attachment, it's clear that faith and so forth are completely contaminated.
The sūtras only say that there are no contaminated faculties.
It's also said that...
'The faculties differ in strength and essence.'
It's because of the distinction between their superior and inferior stages.

source_sentence: 為遮彼執顯位雖殊而根力用一體有故。
translation: It's to obviate their belief that although the manifestation stages are different, the faculties and powers and functions are one and the same.
It's also said that...
'The factor of awakening communicates with contaminants.'
It's because it's explained that the awakening factor of the cultivation of impurity and mindfulness is the same.

translation: In order to obviate their attachment to the manifestation of the awakening factor as only uncontaminated, the sūtras say that both are not shared at the same time.
The sūtras say that it's both present and not both present at the same time.

The sūtras say that joy is the basis for ending escaping sorrow.
In order to obviate that attachment, it's clear that there's no joy in the near part.
The sūtras say that it's been stopped and will be stopped because it's called stopped.
There's also the teaching.
'Correct speech, action, and life don't both exist at the same time.'

'Pre-emergent one-returner also attains meditation.'

source_sentence: 為遮彼執顯俱不得未離欲故。

source_sentence: 此則遮說無色界有無漏戒。
translation: This is a refutation of the claim that there are uncontaminated moral discipline in the formless realm.

source_sentence: 及說上地有正思惟者意。
translation: It's also the point of someone who says there's correct contemplation in the higher realms.
It's because there are no four major types of supports.
It's because the mind in the upper realms gradually becomes subtler.
He asks, "Suppose there are no uncontaminated major types.
Yet there are uncontaminated precepts.
Thus, although there are no major seeds of the other ground, there are precepts of the other ground.
yet there are precepts in the other ground.
What's wrong with that?
A The uncontaminated precepts don't fall into the elementary stages.
They are created according to the great seeds of the body on which they're based.
Although this is the absence of the uncontaminated elements, there are created uncontaminated precepts.
yet there are uncontaminated precepts that are created.
A contaminated precept will surely fall into the realms.
They're created only by the elements in their own body.
Because they don't have the great seeds, the precepts are also absent.

source_sentence: 問若無漏戒隨所依身大種所造者生欲色界入無漏無色定時應起彼定俱無漏戒有所依身大種故。
translation: Q If the uncontaminated precepts are created according to the material elements of the body that they're based on, then when they're born in the desire realm and enter the uncontaminated, formless concentration, they should arise from that concentration, since the uncontaminated precepts are accompanied by the material elements of the body that they're based on.

source_sentence: 答雖無漏戒隨所依身大種所造。
translation: A Although the uncontaminated precepts are created from the elements of the body that are relied upon, where do they have to be in order to have the elements?
However, depending on where they are, they have to be created by the material elements.
Only when there are contaminated precepts do they arise according to that type.

source_sentence: 無漏戒無色中無有大種造。
translation: The uncontaminated precepts have no major seeds created in the formless realm.

source_sentence: 有漏戒故無漏戒於彼亦無。
translation: Because of the contaminated precepts, the uncontaminated precepts don't exist there either.
It's because they exist and give rise to the uncontaminated ones.
Q Why is the essence of the precepts only form?
A It's because it covers the arising of bad form.
It's also because of the nature of physical and verbal actions.
It's because form is the essence of both bodily and verbal actions.
Q Why is intentional action not a precept?
A It's because they can't personally override bad morality.
Q Why are the bad precepts not intentional actions?
A. Those who aren't free of desire will achieve unwholesome mental activity.
They've all accomplished unwholesome intentional actions.

source_sentence: 彼豈悉名犯戒或不律儀耶。
translation: Wouldn't they all be called violating the precepts or being undisciplined?
Therefore, bad precepts are not intentional actions.
Furthermore, if good mental actions are good moral actions, then they should all be called unceasingly good.

source_sentence: 則應一切不斷善者悉名住律儀。
translation: then all those who don't stop being good should be called abiding in discipline.
That's because they all accomplish good mental actions.
If that's allowed, then one sentient being would be called abiding in discipline.
Then a single sentient being would be called abiding in discipline.
They're also called those who abide in undisciplined discipline.
Then there shouldn't be three kinds of distinctions.
Thus, it's contrary to the noble teaching.
Both good and bad precepts are not intentional actions.

source_sentence: 又世共許防禁身語說名戒故。
translation: It's also because the world commonly recognizes the prohibition against speaking physically and calling it a precept.
'Mental actions are not precepts.'
You should know that mental activity is the cause that gives rise to the precepts.
A cause that doesn't lead to precepts is called a precept.
Don't allow the cause and effect to be confused.
Therefore, the only four branches of the path are the formless ones.
In the future, they'll be uncontaminated because they'll cultivate the lower stages in common.
They'll have the eight forms of formless liberation.
The present one is.

The rest are as explained above.
